title: Victoria's Secret employee 'suggested store didn't cater for woman's size or shape' - this was her response
text:
Abbie Walsh-Greenfield has gone public over her treatment when visiting a Victoria's Secret store Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
A curvy woman has written to Victoria's Secret after she claims a store assistant remarked to her and a friend: "Hi.. Are you aware of the sizing in this store?” 
Abbie Walsh-Greenfield, 20, believes her treatment on Monday was down to her size and wrote an open letter to the lingerie chain on her blog, Wales Online reports. 
She wrote: “Stores like this don’t intimidate me. Walking around this store is the same as walking around the next. 
“I didn't feel uncomfortable by the lack of XL’s (I actually don’t believe that I saw one in that size, anyway), nor by the 5 X-Smalls, 4 Smalls, 2 Medium, 1 Large and 0 X-Large ratio that seemed to be a common theme on the rails around the store. It wasn't even that, that had bothered me.” Victoria's Secret says it is reaching out to the customer 
As she walked around round the store, she says that one of the shop assistants walked past her “average sized friend” and said to her: “Hi.. Are you aware of the sizing in this store?” 
She said it left her feeling uncomfortable, so she left. 
She wrote: “I don’t actually know what the sales assistant meant by her comment, but surely there’s no two ways about it. 
“I can’t even imagine another sentence that she could have tried to say.” 
Ms Walsh-Greenfield said: “I know I am not a small person and I think that is why she said it. Read More 
“I was going to go back and complain but I did not want to put myself in that store.” 
Ms Walsh-Greenfield said she believes off-hand comments can really affect people with low self esteem. 
She went on to spend money at Ann Summers instead, because she was made to feel comfortable. 
She finished the letter: “So, just to let you know Victoria’s Secret Cardiff, I spent £100 in Ann Summers that exact day, and probably got double what £100 would have got me in VS. Read More 5 sexiest looks from the Victoria's Secret Fashion Show 2016 
“And besides that, besides the money which doesn't really matter, the staff in there were so lovely and kind, and no one questioned my size once, or my friends. 
"They were helpful and informative and actually did what they could to help. They made me feel comfortable.” 
In a statement, a Victoria’s Secret spokesperson said: “Victoria’s Secret expects that all customers be treated with respect. 
"We are reaching out to the customer and will take the appropriate actions as we’re committed to ensuring that everyone feels welcome in our stores.” Like us on Facebook
